utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Telling you, Will, you got a real winner here. She's just gonna love it.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Stacy, box her up. Oh. Just the box. I'm sure it's prettier than the paper. One tiny rock. So many other cool things I could have bought for myself. Sam, Stacy, it's been a pleasure being ripped off by you.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Such a nice boy. Too bad he's a handicap.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Excuse me. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: You all right, man? Take it easy, man! It's okay. It's okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kid's a blind diabetic. He's hyperglycemic hyperosmolar.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Which is what we thought until his blood tests showed a controlled sugar level and no ketones.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It could be caused by drug abuse.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His tox screens were clean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You lying sack of crap.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I have them right in front of me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not you. This time. My former BFF. He's S-M-I-T-B-A-W-S. Stabbing me in the back as we speak.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Where exactly are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If anyone should happen to ask, I'm in an out-of-state medical conference until further notice.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Why would any—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And… don't really care. Auditory hallucinations and disorientation could be signs of schizophrenia.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: They did a psych consult. Mental status is normal.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Seizure, noise-induced epilepsy — the sound of rush hour traffic could have set it off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Run an E.E.G. Blast his brain with harmonics to find out. Also, if anyone should further happen to ask, I spent the whole last year in Africa with Doctors Without Boundaries.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Who are you hiding from?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Evil.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Where's House?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, he's at an out-of-state medical conference. In Baltimore, I think.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Nice to meet you. I'm Blythe, his mother.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Do you want me to pick up the Braille writer and laptop from your apartment?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: I don't plan on being here that long. I didn't eat lunch yesterday. I probably just fainted.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Or had an epileptic seizure.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Which is only one possibility. I'm Doctor Chase. Uh, we'd like to discuss your case with you privately.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: I'm his girlfriend. Is it all right if I stay for this?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Melissa can stay. And I've never had a seizure before in my life.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They can be mild. Like a loss of concentration or a muscle tremor.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: A lot of times a family member notices before the patient does. I'm Doctor Park, by the way. I'm 5'2", Asian, and I'm totally cool with it if you wanna feel my face.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Blind people only do that in movies.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: But you sound nice, so if you want me to…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her point was, you may not have realized you were having a seizure, but maybe your girlfriend has?

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: No. But I-I haven't seen him for the last five months. We were on a break.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Like Rachel and Ross on Friends. Never seen the show myself, but I hear it's good. That joke usually kills my blind friends.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Will, this is serious.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: No, it's not. Since I don't have epilepsy. I have to pay attention to every signal my body sends or receives. Or I end up taking a dirt nap. You don't think I'd know if I was having seizures? It's probably just low blood sugar.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If that's true, then you shouldn't have a problem passing our test.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: How is he, James, really?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's better than I've seen him in a long time.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Is he happy?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Uh…

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: It's okay. He's always been a complicated child.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Were you in the hospital recently?

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Oh, nothing serious. I just had a few moles removed yesterday and forgot I even had it on. Look, if Greg happens to get back early from the conference, I'm staying at a hotel in town for the next three days. I would like him to call me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I will pass it on.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Thank you. Um, do you think that they would mind if I got a refill for the road?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not at all.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Not seeing any seizure activity in response to low frequency sounds. I'm starting him on mid-range.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Have you seen his girlfriend? Extremely hot.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Blind people can't have attractive girlfriends?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not my point. He actually convinced her to go for the whole relationship break thing.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How do you know it wasn't her idea?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Because she's back with him. Women suggest a break when they wanna break up. Men do it because they wanna have sex with other women before they settle down.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: They're a little young to get married, don't you think?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was their age when I did. I see your point.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He's seizing. Sound frequency's at 300 hertz.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not a seizure. He's not spiking on his E.E.G.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's not moving air. I think he's choking on something.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Blood. I don't see any blockage.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Help me move him.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Just relax and breathe.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: What-what are these?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Three teeth detached from his jawbone and lodged in his throat. He almost choked to death on them.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Environmental? Could be heavy metal poisoning or radiation exposure.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Then he wouldn't be the only one. He's an accountant who works on the same floor with 50 other people.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Maybe his girlfriend poisoned him. House usually thinks that's a good guess. And she's gotta be pissed off and have low self-esteem. Why else would she give him a free pass to pork other women?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because he's handicapped. Women feel sorry for us. This cane is tail bait.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Where are you now?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Expect an actual answer this time?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Hi, guys. Was wondering if House's mother left yet. He won't let me go to our hous—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not environmental, it's periodontitis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: An oral infection doesn't explain his disorientation and auditory hallucinations.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They're laughing because they know diabetes exacerbates the condition.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It could progress to a systemic disease. The bacteria spread and affect other organs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like his brain. Start him on broad-spectrum antibiotics and book him an appointment with a periodontist.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He has fake children now, too?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: You think I'm not good enough for your mother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not in front of the kids, honey. Hey, add a couple of flies, toss in a dead goat or two, we might have a winner. She gone?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. We really need to talk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Crayons down. Line up if you wanna get paid. It's the only time I ever successfully lie to my mom; is through the elaborate preparations and props.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey. I said no Transformers, Slick. Stay here until the coast is clear.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You sleeping with her now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just in case an I.N.S. guy comes in through the window.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, she didn't buy it either.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You need to talk to your mother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When I'm ready. Still need to get a fake passport, doctored photos, maybe a case of AIDS.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She's sick, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did she say that?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She was wearing a hospital admission bracelet and carrying around a book on dealing with terminal cancer. I'm sorry. She's staying at the Grand for the next three days.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: The antibiotics will stop the infection from spreading further.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And I'll spare you the lecture you'll get from the periodontist tomorrow, but you need to practice better oral hygiene.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: So are you guys saying this is happening because, what, I didn't floss enough?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Probably didn't help, but diabetics are prone to this type of infection.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Half the time, he doesn't even bother getting undressed before he goes to bed. Can only imagine how many times you've skipped brushing your teeth since we— Sorry. I don't mean to lecture you, babe.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Well, I guess you're right. Look, you haven't eaten anything all day. Why don't you go grab a bite? I'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: All right, well, I'll see you in an hour, okay?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Not if I see you first. I was wondering if I could ask you guys for a favor. I really need my laptop and Braille writer, and I can't ask Melissa to get them for me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Because… I want you to put this someplace safe.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: People always say diamonds are beautiful. But to me they just feel cold. They have really sharp edges.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I guess convincing her to take a break was a good thing.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Well, the break was her idea. Melissa's the only girl I've ever dated. She wanted me to be sure before we… took the next step.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We're here. We might as well search the place in case we're wrong about periodontitis. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We're here. Might as well eat.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're stealing food from a blind man?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We're doing him a favor. He owes me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I take it from your low self-esteem theory you have some experience with relationship breaks? What happened?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He talked me into it, then… slept with three of my friends. Then dumped my ass. College boyfriend. Thought he was the love of my life.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Then why agree to a break?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: My self-esteem wasn't as high back then.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No one's is.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Ugh! Sugar free! Ugh. Disgusting.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll check the bathroom. You keep checking the snacks,

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Greg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry I didn't call first. I just flew back from my conference.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Um, this—this really isn't, uh—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need your medical records and the name of your primary physician.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Well, you remember Mr. Bell.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if I didn't, I will now. You're not dying?

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: I, uh… I may have misled James by letting him see a book on cancer.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: [We did, however, have some expectations that you might call first.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Yeah. This isn't how I envisioned you finding out. Mr. Bell and I, we're…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Having sex. Got it.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Getting married. Also.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: We wanted you to be the first to know.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I need 10 milligrams of benzodiazepine.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Help me hold him down.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'm putting epilepsy back on the table.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And I'm taking it off because it doesn't explain losing his teeth.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The kid's diabetic. The periodontitis could be real but completely unrelated.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Coincidence. Buying that, House?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Until I hear something that takes my mind off the Jurassic schlong that I was traumatized by this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I know what's wrong with the patient. Illegal drugs. Some kind of acid.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His tox screens were clean.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: His apartment wasn't.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We didn't find any drugs.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Then why am I completely tripping balls right now? I'm seriously freaking out here, guys. Can't you tell?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You pretty much look the same as you always do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take your glasses off. Pupils dilated… Pulse elevated. Hallucinating?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I think so, because… he's a rabbit.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Oh, I get it. Because she's his wife. They flirt a lot. I've seen things.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Mm, Taub— Taub is either… a tooth fairy or… Rainbow Brite.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: And you… you're just House.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She ate ice cream and Gummi Bears at the patient's apartment. One of 'em must have been dosed with it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go back and find the drugs. You two, find out where he bought them, and then MRI his brain. Check for infections, masses, and plaques.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Am I gonna die?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We'll get back to you on that.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: I've been blind since birth. I thought maybe if I tried LSD, I might, you know… Colors… a shape. I just-I just wanted to see something.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How many times?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Maybe five or six.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We need to know where you bought it so we can find out what was in it.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: My girlfriend gave it to me.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'll find her.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: No, don't. It-it wasn't Melissa. I met someone else.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: When were you planning on telling her that, before or after you ask her to marry you?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: The ring isn't for her. We were on a break. She wanted me to see what else was out there, and I did. I was gonna tell her the other night, but I ended up here instead.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We just need to talk to the one who supplied the drugs.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: She's on vacation with her parents. This is her cell. I don't want her to know I'm in the hospital. She'll only freak out.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That's very considerate of you.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: You think this is easy for me. I know I have to tell Melissa.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Well, what's stopping you?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: She's still one of my best friends. And I don't want to be alone in here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Have you seen your mother yet?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's not dying. She was having sex with my father. Ignore her. She's on acid.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your father's dead, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not the dead dad, the biological dad. The one I pointed out to you at fake father's funeral.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Huh. Are you sure? Your only evidence is that birthmark you saw when you were 12.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, now I've seen two. Good news is, I won't technically be a bastard much longer. We're gonna be one big, crappy family.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, that's-that's great news. Your mother won't be alone anymore, and you can finally get to know the guy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, that is one option.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Are you saying you're not even curious? You want to know what I think?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think you know the answer to that question.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You avoid your mother because she's the one person whose opinion you actually care about.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If that was true, you'd have every reason to shut up. I avoid my mother because she's boring.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's why you've been so open and honest about prison and marrying a complete stranger.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Even if I care what she thinks, why would I care what some sperm donor does?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You read the guy's book about three times.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Years ago. It took three times because it was so badly written.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Oh, I get it. The second birthmark was on his penis, right?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He's a dick.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You've been working for House for months and just now realized that disabled people can also be dicks?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What he's doing now to that girl isn't fair.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The break was her idea.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And now she thinks they're back together.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's a scared, sick, blind kid who doesn't want to be alone. You really don't get that?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I do, but…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Not good news for him… or Park.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Where's Park?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson's babysitting her. Talking about the fact that she could have permanent brain damage might bum her trip out a little bit.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A dark spot doesn't necessarily equal brain damage. It could be a congenital malformation connected with his blindness or a tumor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A clot.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Exactly. We need to do another scan, but inject dye and figure out—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said "a clot," not "or a clot." It's a clot. Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Good news for Park. I've never seen one present this large before.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It fits. When it was smaller, it caused his initial disorientation and hallucinations. As it grew larger, the seizures.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If left untreated, it leads to cerebral edema and death. But what causes that and tooth loss?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Any hyper-coagulable state. Lupus?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I counter your lupus with Behcet's syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, he doesn't have any of the earlier symptoms — color blindness, abnormal visual fields or— We've been ignoring his eyes because he's blind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if he wasn't before, he would be by now. Confirm with an eye exam, start treatment with heparin for the clot. Interferon and steroids for the Behcet's.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, no!

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Give me back my teeth!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Park, listen. Park—

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You're a tooth thief!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, no, no. Stop it, stop it! Ki-ki-ki! Back on the couch.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: What are you doing to this poor girl?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's not what it looks like. She— Oh! She's tripping on acid.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Good lord, man, that's no way to treat a bad trip. Put the chair down. You'll end up hurting the poor wee thing. There you are. Hello, darlin'. I'm Thomas, and this beautiful creature here is Blythe. Is there anything we can do to help you?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: That rabbit stole my teeth.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Of course he did, but I'll tell you what he's done. He's put them back again, and they're twice as nice as they used to be. You can feel them if you like. See? Now, why don't we sit on this nice comfy couch, have a nice cool drink and talk all about it. Would you like that?

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: He's had some experience with things like this, back in the day.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: As I recall, both of us—

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Uh, not the time or the place, dear.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: There you are. See? There you are.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There's no way that guy's related to you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There's fresh scarring and swelling in both fundi, and a bleed on the left. House was right. It's Behcet's syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Give it to me straight, Doc. Am I ever gonna see again?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's a little out of our jurisdiction. We need to wrap a dressing over your eyes to keep the light out.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: It’s not really a problem for me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You might not see it, but your tissue does. It'll also help with the swelling. I'll leave you in Dr. Adams' capable hands.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: You think I'm an ass, don't you? I can tell by your breathing. Either you're angry or fat.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I think it's unfair that you're leading on a woman who obviously loves and cares about you.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: I love and care about her too. But we just don't work together as a couple.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You need to tell her that.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: I'm going to. But I just want to do it the right way. I don't want her to hate me.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: When she finds out you bought an engagement ring for another woman, that option is out the window.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: It was gonna be for her.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What changed?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: She told me we were going on a break. I didn't even get a say in the matter.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: She wanted you to be sure about your relationship. I can see how that would be annoying.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: I think I liked it better when you were just breathing angrily. She still sees me as the same sheltered, blind geek she met in college. Most of the time she acts more like my mother than my girlfriend. I asked her to marry me. She tells me I need to date somebody else first. I'd rather she just dumped me. At least that I can understand.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: So you were hurt so much you had to marry the next woman you met?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Julie doesn't see me as I was, but for who I am now. She trusts me to make my own decisions and to help her with hers. For the first time in my life, I have somebody who needs me… instead of the other way around.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Ah, she finally fell asleep. I think she'll be fine in a couple of hours.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How do you know about handling a bad acid trip? Friends in your gardening club been experimenting again?

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: I was young once. A little scrapbook that Thomas threw together. He even has a couple of pictures of you as a child.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: And I've known Greg almost since he was born, you know. His father and I were like brothers. I was a Navy chaplain in those days. I left the service in the late '60s. I don't think his dad ever forgave me for protesting the war. Of course, if he knew I'd got Blythe involved…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You protested the war? When?

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: You were a child. I didn't share my entire schedule with you.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Well we knew if we told you, you'd tell him, and he'd kill us both. He was a marine. It was the ultimate betrayal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Penultimate.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Sweetheart, I think we need to get back to the hotel.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Wilson, it's been a real pleasure. You're right. Much too formal. Come here, lad. We're practically family now.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: We'll see you boys tonight.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: 8:00 sharp. I invited them out to dinner. Told them it was your idea.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Straw. I know we agreed that whatever happened on break would stay on break, and I don't expect you to talk about yours. But I just want you to know that there was no one else. I missed you so much, I barely even saw my own friends. I'm just so glad it's finally over. Are you okay? What's happening to him?

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Is he going to be okay?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm going to need to discuss that with my colleagues.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: We have to talk.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: No, you need to rest.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: I have to tell you about… about what happened on break.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Later. You just lie back and relax—

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Stop it, Melissa! Just stop telling me what I need, and listen for once, okay?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Embarrassed. I'm still not sure what was real or what I hallucinated. Did you try to kiss me? What about you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's stabilized for the moment.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Coughing up blood. That doesn't really change anything. Hemoptysis is a symptom of Behcet's.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Except our treatment should make him better, not worse.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It could be doing both. Our treatment breaks down his clot in his head, like it's supposed to, except a piece broke off and traveled to one of his arteries in his lungs. If anything, we need to increase the heparin to prevent further clots from forming.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: If we do that and he starts hemorrhaging, we won't be able to stop the bleeding.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If we don't do that, the next clot could cause a heart attack or a stroke. Park's way, he at least has a shot at living. CT his lungs to confirm, and up the dose.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's young and hot. She'll bounce back.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Eighty-two pounds. How much weight I put on when my break ended the same way. People were calling me Park-ing-lot.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Hmm… Almost 9:00. I think your boy is gonna stand us up.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: No, no, he'll be here.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Practically walked in on us having sex. God, if I saw my mother doing that, I'd claw my own eyes out. Of course, she was nowhere near as attractive as you. Horribly fat, as a matter of fact.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mother… Guy sleeping with my mother, this is Dominika, my wife.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: It's so nice to be meeting you. And Gregory tells me that you were born in Richmond, Virginia, and your father was a tailor who stole from his clients.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: James has persuaded me of the value of openness and honesty in relationships.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We see people with disabilities all the time, but… seeing and understanding aren't always the same thing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are you talking to me or writing a Facebook post?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'm saying we should have picked up on the degeneration in his eyes sooner. We ignored them because we assumed they weren't even part of the equation. I also realized, intellectually, I may understand what it means to be disabled, but emotionally, I didn't have a clue. Apparently, his girlfriend didn't either.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So you're back on his side?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's not a side. It's a perspective. He just wants to be treated like an adult, make his own decisions. I may not agree with all of them, but how the hell can I judge him?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm sure that's exactly what disabled people want, to be treated like completely foreign entities, incapable of being judged and understood. Park was right about the clot. Hopefully the anticoagulants keep it from killing him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So… she gets the couch on the odd nights, and I get the bed on evens. In exchange for a federal felony, she gets a green card, and I get a live-in maid.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Good for you. The immigration policy in this country is a travesty. It forces people to lie just so nice people can stay here.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Thank you… Dad.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm grateful you approve. You should also know that I was not in Africa the last year.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: You were in jail. I've been reading the Princeton police blotter ever since you moved here. And I'm afraid I haven't been truthful with you either. And I've wanted to tell you this for a very long time. Thomas and I… we got married two months after your father passed away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: You understand, we didn't want you to think we were disrespecting the memory of your father.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And… is there another secret that you want to share with me?

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's nothing you think might be relevant to my life?

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Like… what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know. Just off the top of my head, something like I DNA-tested my dad and found that he was not my biological father — you are.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: That's impossible.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: People lie. Birthmarks don't.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Oh, my God! You told me he was a premie. This bloody lunatic is my son!

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: He's not a lunatic.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: All those years you could have told me. I could have done things. That could have made a difference in the boy's life.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think we should all just calm down.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Look at him sitting there — a pill-popping sociopath! If you wanted to screw up his life, you couldn't have done it better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's got you there, mom.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: He's one of the most well-respected doctors in the world. He's saved more lives than you can count. Now, you apologize to him, or I swear, you will never see me again, Thomas.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: I can't deal with this anymore. He's my son? I'm having a bloody breath of fresh air, that's what I'm doing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, who's for dessert?

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Somebody help me! Uhh! Somebody—

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Will? It's Dr. Adams and Dr. Chase. We just need to know—

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: My eyes! My eyes! It feels like it's on fire!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not Behcet's. It doesn't necrotize tissue like this. I think it's streptococcus pyogenes.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Except we've already treated him with broad-spectrum antibiotics. It shouldn't be spreading. It should be dying.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just means it's drug-resistant. We need to remove what's left of his eyes before the gangrene sets in.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's something that looks and acts like a bacteria but isn't one. Could be viral.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, it couldn't. No evidence of viral markers in the necrotized tissue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let me see that image you took last night of the clot in his lung. That's not a piece of the clot from his brain. That's the point of infection. Mucormycosis. He breathed in the spores, it's been growing and spreading ever since.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A fungal infection spreading this fast?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kid's a diabetic. He already has a compromised immune system.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He's right. This sample from his eyes is crawling with it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Treat with amphotericin B.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We treated him with gentamicin when we thought it was bacterial, which means the dose of amphotericin B we'll need to cure him will probably leave him deaf.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, I stopped listening after you said "the dose we'll need to cure him."

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Blind and deaf? I'd rather be dead.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You will be.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: I can live with that. You never did get my humor.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: There's a chance your hearing won't be completely gone.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: How much of a chance?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: A small one. But a chance.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: I'm-I'm refusing treatment. You don't know how hard things are already for me. I can't handle any more. I can't.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Oh, hi. I'm here to apologize. I could have handled the news with more… aplomb? I have a son. That's great news.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What else did she tell you to say?

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: You're not a lunatic, you're not a mistake.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I never liked your friend… my father.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Well, he could be a bit intense at times.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But unlike you, I did respect him.

utterance.speaker: Thomas
utterance.content: Do you respect your mother? Well, we do have that in common. And we all love her. So we don't have much choice, do we? Son, see you at dinner.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Will, it's me.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Let me guess. The doctor who thinks I'm an ass wants you to convince me to live.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: It won't work.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: I know. So I won't.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Wow. You're that angry?

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: I've made enough decisions for you. This is your life.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Why'd you come back?

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Because I love you. And I want to be with you for as long as I can.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Melissa, I'm so scared.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Me too. I'll always love you.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Even if I was deaf?

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Even if anything.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Is it working?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He's still very ill, but if he keeps responding the way he has been, he should be fine.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: And his hearing?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's gone. We don't know yet if it'll be permanent.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Melissa? Is that you?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We've been squeezing his hand, once for yes, twice for no.

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: Can I ask you something? I completely understand if you squeeze no. Wh-will you marry me? Don't leave me hanging, now.

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Yes. Yes! Of course, yes!

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: I-I heard that. You said yes, right?

utterance.speaker: Melissa
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Will
utterance.content: You said y—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How long are you gonna wait until you tell me?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I thought we already had the Santa Claus talk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't think I saw you steal Thomas' fork from the restaurant?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For his DNA.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's… that's… very observant of you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See, you're more me than you pretend. You had to know for sure. So you needed proof. The fact that you haven't told me can only mean…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He isn't your father either. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know what that means.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your mom's a slut.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That… and… she's not as boring as I thought she was.
